Row validation isn't actually in the CTP but will be in the v1 release.  However, normal property binding validation works.  For an example of that see this thread, http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=34776

vinsibal

Row validation means to keep the cursor in a row until all errors are corrected?

Regards
Klaus

Row validation is tied in with the BindingGroup feature so you can specify item-level validation in the DataGrid.  When validation fails there will be a default behavior where the row is not committed but that doesn't mean the cursor is kept on the row until all errors are corrected.
